byline.original: By DONALD G. McNEIL Jr. and SABRINA TAVERNISE

abstract: World Health Organization says Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro may proceed and athletes and spectators, with the exception of pregnant women, should feel comfortable attending; organization stresses risk of contracting disease in August, Brazil's winter, is low but ordinary precautions should be taken.
lead_paragraph: The agency said that, with the exception of pregnant women, athletes and spectators should not hesitate to attend the Olympics in Rio de Janeiro this summer.

headline.main: W.H.O. Says Olympics Should Go Ahead in Brazil Despite Zika Virus
headline.print_headline: Olympics Can Go Forward Despite Zika, W.H.O. Says

snippet: The agency said that, with the exception of pregnant women, athletes and spectators should not hesitate to attend the Olympics in Rio de Janeiro this summer.
